topicmeta.shortdesc: With these recipes, you'll be able to make a delicious breakfast to satisfy your taste buds and start your day off right!
Avocado toast is so trendy right now and allows you to come up with new twists and variations on the original.
An easy, savory, fluffy, and delicious omelette for breakfast lovers. This omelette can be filled and topped with anything you like!
These hearty and home style baked breakfast potatoes are so easy and will become a go-to recipe.
This smoothie is packed with protein and will satisfy your sweet tooth to save you from reaching for that doughnut

topicmeta.navtitle: Raspberry Lemon Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting
topicmeta.linktext: Raspberry Lemon Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting
topicmeta.shortdesc: You can't have breakfast without something sweet! This lightly sweetened cake has a lovely, balanced flavor of fresh raspberries and lemon.
If you're too tired to cook or don't have the right ingredients on hand but still need to start your day off right below is a list of recommended breakfast places nearby.

concept.title: Breakfast Guide
concept.shortdesc: With these recipes, you'll be able to make a delicious breakfast to satisfy your taste buds and start your day off right!

task.domains: (topic task) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Avocado Toast
task.shortdesc: Avocado toast is so trendy right now and allows you to come up with new twists and variations on the original.

taskbody.prereq:
This recipe requires a skillet and a knife. You will also need the following ingredients:
2 slices cooked bacon, crumbled
1 avocado Peel back the stem of the avocado to check for ripeness. If it comes away easily and is green underneath it is ripe and ready to eat.
1 lime, halved
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
chili flakes to taste (optional)
crumbled goat cheese to taste (optional)
2 slices of bread

step.cmd: Slice open the avocado
Scoop out the flesh of the avocado and add it to a bowl along with the juice of one lime
Use a fork to mash the avocado and season with salt, pepper and chili flakes (optional)
Toast the slices of bread
To assemble, slather the slices of toast with mashed avocado and top with
Serve immediately

task.domains: (topic task) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Simple Omelette
task.shortdesc: An easy, savory, fluffy, and delicious omelette for breakfast lovers. This omelette can be filled and topped with anything you like!

taskbody.prereq:
For this recipe you will need an oven-safe skillet, a rubber spatula, a food processor, and an oven mitt. Ingredients are as follows:
2 eggs
2 tbsp water
1 tsp butter
1 cup of veggies of choice
1/3 cup ham, finely chopped
1/3 cup shredded cheese
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

step.cmd: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F
Beat eggs, water, salt and pepper in small bowl until blended
Heat butter in a small-to-medium, oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Tilt pan to coat bottom
Add the veggies to the skillet. Season with salt and pepper and sauté to desired doneness
Pour in the omelette batter and cook over medium heat on the stove top for 5 minutes until the edges start to dry
Place skillet in oven and bake until dry and deep golden brown – 10-15 minutes. The longer it bakes the less soft/wet it will be, so if you prefer a more “well done” omelet, cook closer to 15 or more
Carefully remove from oven with oven mitt and fold over gently with a spatula. If it doesn’t want to fold, you can serve it scrambled!
Serve with desired toppings and enjoy!

taskbody.result: You should expect a full stomach after enjoying this wholesome omelette!
taskbody.postreq: If you're still not full, follow the recipe link below to make some potatoes to go along with your omelette!

link.desc: These hearty and home style baked breakfast potatoes are so easy and will become a go-to recipe.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Best Ever Breakfast Potatoes
task.shortdesc: These hearty and home style baked breakfast potatoes are so easy and will become a go-to recipe.

taskbody.prereq:
Materials for this recipe include a large mixing bowl, a measuring cup, and a baking sheet. Ingredients are as follows:
5 pounds red potatoes, roughly chopped
4 cloves garlic, minced
1 onion, chopped
1 green bell pepper, seeded and roughly chopped
1 red bell pepper, seeded and roughly chopped
1/4 cup olive oil
1/2 stick butter melted
1 tsp seasoned salt
1/2 tsp cayenne pepper
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
5 slices of cooked bacon, crumbled (optional)

step.cmd: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F
In a large bowl, toss together the potatoes, garlic, onion, green bell pepper, red bell pepper, olive oil, butter, seasoned salt, cayenne pepper and some kosher salt and pepper.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, shaking the pan twice
Raise the heat to 500 degrees and bake until crisp and brown, 10 to 15 minutes
Sprinkle with a little more salt and pepper and crumbled bacon bits (optional) before serving.

taskbody.postreq: Store the leftover potatoes in an airtight container in the fridge. Let other people know they're in there so they don't go to waste!

task.domains: (topic task) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Peanut Butter Oatmeal Smoothie
task.shortdesc: This smoothie is packed with protein and will satisfy your sweet tooth to save you from reaching for that doughnut

taskbody.prereq:
For this recipe you will need a blender. Ingredients are as follows:
1/2 cup milk
2 tbsp peanut butter
1 whole banana
1/4 cup old-fashioned oats

step.cmd: Add all ingredients to the blender.

info.note: Be sure that the blender is unplugged and in an "off" position while adding ingredients or stirring. The blades are sharp and could cause injury if not careful.

step.cmd: Blend on a medium speed for 30 seconds then turn blender off
Remove lid and stir ingredients
Place lid back on blender and blend on a medium speed for 30-60 seconds until smoothie is at desired consistency
Pour smoothie into glass
Serve with desired toppings and enjoy!

taskbody.postreq: This smoothie will fill you up without weighing you down. Because you chose a healthier alternative for breakfast, you can eat more dessert at dinnertime!

topic.title: Raspberry Lemon Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting
topic.shortdesc: You can't have breakfast without something sweet! This lightly sweetened cake has a lovely, balanced flavor of fresh raspberries and lemon.

section.title: Ingredients and Tools
section.p: For this recipe, you will need a sift, a 5 x 9in bread pan, a large mixing bowl, and a hand mixer. Ingredients are as follows:

li.p: 1 cup Plain So Delicious Dairy Free Coconut milk yogurt alternative
1 cup Plain So Delicious Dairy Free Coconut milk yogurt alternative
Grease and flour a 5 x 9 inch bread pan
Sift the flour to combine with baking powder, baking soda, salt, lemon zest and sugar
In a separate bowl, combine the water, olive oil, plain yogurt, vanilla extract, lemon juice and melted butter
Mix the dry and wet ingredients together to make a smooth batter. Gently fold in raspberries
Pour the mixture in the bread form and bake for 35-40 minutes or until a knife comes out clean. Carefully remove the cake from the pan and cool completely
In a large mixing bowl, add the 3 1/2 sticks of butter , 2 cups of powdered sugar and half of the vanilla yogurt. Beat using a hand mixer until creamed and combined
Add in an additional 2 cups of powdered sugar and beat to incorporate
Add remaining yogurt and another 2 cups powdered sugar. Beat to combine
Add additional powdered sugar 1/2 cup at a time until the desired consistency is reached. It should be between 7 and 8 cups total
Spread the frosting over the cooled caked and garnish with raspberries if desired

section.p: Slice the cake to serve. Be sure to wrap with plastic wrap to store when finished so the cake remains moist

fig.title: Raspberry Lemon Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting

body.p: To see where the recipes were adapted from or to find more breakfast recipes follow the links below to explore!

concept.title: Tired of Cooking
concept.shortdesc: If you're too tired to cook or don't have the right ingredients on hand but still need to start your day off right below is a list of recommended breakfast places nearby.

conbody.p: Lefty's is the perfect local place to eat breakfast. It's one of the locals' favorite hotspots so it can get a bit crowded. I suggest going before 11am or as early as possible.

image.alt: Eating out is a great solution when you're too tired to cook
